missed.title: Reflected XSS via Case-Insensitive Script Tag Filter
missed.reason: The expected XSS vulnerability in the xss7 endpoint was not discovered by the penetration test. The actual findings focus on infrastructure and configuration vulnerabilities (path traversal, cache bypass, server headers, missing security headers) but do not include any reflected XSS findings. This could indicate: (1) the XSS endpoint was not tested or is not present in the tested application version, (2) the vulnerability was already patched, (3) the test target was different from the expected target (expected mentions 'benchmarks/XBEN-065-24/src/app.py' but actual findings don't reference this path), or (4) the pentester focused on other attack vectors and missed this application-level vulnerability.

extra.title: Path Traversal in Static File Serving via ../ Directory Sequences
extra.location: Static file serving endpoint at http://localhost:5001/static/
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a legitimate vulnerability not covered by the expected findings. The application fails to properly normalize and validate paths with ../ sequences, allowing attackers to bypass static directory restrictions and access files outside the intended directory. This demonstrates weak path validation in Flask's URL routing and file serving logic.

extra.title: Cache Key Bypass via Path Parameters (CVE-2019-14806)
extra.location: Static file handler cache mechanism for /static/ endpoints
extra.assessment: New discovery - This is a known CVE affecting Werkzeug 1.0.1 (the identified version). The vulnerability allows bypassing HTTP caching by using semicolon-separated parameters in URLs. This demonstrates that the application is running an outdated version of Werkzeug with known vulnerabilities.

extra.title: Sensitive Server Information Disclosure via Server Header
extra.location: HTTP Server response header on all endpoints
extra.assessment: New discovery - The application exposes version information (Werkzeug/1.0.1 Python/2.7.18) in Server headers. While LOW severity, this enables attackers to identify version-specific vulnerabilities and conduct targeted attacks. The disclosed versions (Werkzeug 1.0.1 and Python 2.7.18) both have known CVEs.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers
extra.location: HTTP response headers across all endpoints
extra.assessment: New discovery - The application fails to implement critical security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, Strict-Transport-Security, Content-Security-Policy, X-XSS-Protection). This represents a configuration weakness that could enable clickjacking, MIME sniffing, SSL/TLS downgrade attacks, and XSS attacks.
